intro: Stenocalyx dasyblastus, commonly known as the woolly stenocalyx, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, adding to its ornamental value. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated as a decorative plant in gardens and greenhouses.
